Articles.Content:
Tried to make my own ion glider, took a few wrong turns, used too much parts. But anyway, I like how it looks. And, due to some KSP bug it is can still fly pretty good.

It gains unnatural acceleration on sharp turns around 90 degrees.

The first control module is placed horizontally, and the nav sphere is disoriented at launch. Its still flyable this way but if you want a proper working navigation - switch to control from backup OKTO2 which is on a back side of the nose cone. Or just get a kerbal on the seat.

So uh, have fun.

http://imgur.com/a/Rg6BN#0

Shortbow A.craft

Shortbow B.craft
Welcome to the wonderful world of infini-glide. If you work the controls correctly you can achieve amazing speeds with it and even trigger mach and re-entry effects.

I just tried something with this effect

The probe I made covered with flaps was able to take off at 2 m/s and within 20 seconds I was going 500 m/s

I have infiniglided at up to 1200 m/s within 5 seconds.

The secret: spam W and S keys.

Spica
